title: Mum buys £200 of clothes from House of Fraser for just 2p in incredible deal
text:

A mum has bagged what could be the deal of the year - picking up a dress and a top worth £200 for just 2p.

Natalie Durant saw the discounted top and dress on the House of Fraser website with a massive discount.

"After never being lucky enough to find such bargains, I was so pleased to actually get myself something nice for so cheap, especially this time of year when it's time to start Christmas shopping," Natalie said.

"I just so happened to randomly check the House of Fraser website one morning and there were some other items for 1p.

"I quickly ordered them, thinking they would end up emailing me saying they were out of stock or not available, but luckily the order was processed and the items arrived on Monday."

(Image: Natalie Durant/Deadline News)

(Image: Natalie Durant/Deadline News)

(Image: Natalie Durant/Deadline News)

Mum-of-three Natalie managed to nab a monochrome striped wrap dress worth £149 and a silky tie-neck top worth £49, both for just 1p each.

And she has big plans for her new outfits.

"Myself and my partner are planning our first date night since our baby girl was born, so I'll probably wear the top for that and make an effort from my usual school run attire," she said.

"It's nice to treat myself without having to break the bank or feel guilty."

The 31-year-old dental nurse from Lowestoft isn't the first to manage to find an incredible bargain either.

Last week Michelle Nolan, from Liverpool, picked up four dresses - normally costing £139 each - for just 4p.

"I thought it must have been a glitch," Michelle told money-saving community LatestDeals.co.uk .

But it wasn't - and a few days later the dresses, which normally sell for £139 each, were delivered.

"I honestly didn’t expect them to turn up," Michelle said.

And she has some advice for people looking to find this sort of bargain yourself.

"Always check the sale categories and sort by price low to high: that way, you see what the best deals are without having to go through the thousands of sale pages,” Michelle said.
description: Natalie Durant, from Suffolk, didn't think her 2p order would be honoured at first, but now the clothes has arrived she has big plans for them
